2005.question: Among the following the glacial landform is:
A river that maintains its course by valley deepening during uplift is termed:

2006.question: Match the following:Group I: P. Braid bars Q. Moraines R. Barchans S. Atoll Group II: 1. Wind 2. Riverine 3. Marine 4. Glacial

2007.question: Barchans are crescent-shaped dunes in which the ends of the crescent:
options: are at right angles to the wind direction
have no relation to the wind direction

2007.question: A geomorphic feature produced at divergent plate boundary is:
A graded stream is characterized by:
options: increase in erosion relative to deposition
increase in deposition relative to erosion

2007.question: Match the following landforms (Group I) with the corresponding geological agents (Group II): Group I: P. Point Bar Q. Cirque R. Yardang S. Berm Group II: 1. Sea 2. River 3. Glacier 4. Wind

2008.question: Dripstone found rising up from the floor of a limestone cave is known as :
Which one of the following drainage patterns is observed in a massiv granitic terrain?

2009.question: The raised area adjacent to a stream channel that is produced by frequent flooding and overbank deposition is:
Which of the following is a product of aeolian processes?

2010.question: Circular reefs enclosing shallow body of water are called:

2011.question: Glaciers are downward moving bodies of:
options: Mostly ice and some snow at the top
Mostly snow and some ice at the top
Snow and ice in alternate layers
2011.answer: Mostly ice and some snow at the top

2011.question: Which of the following landforms is NOT the result of strike-slip faulting?
Hanging valley is developed when rate of glacial erosion:
options: Is greater in the main valley as compared to the side valley
Is greater in the side valley as compared to the main valley
Is the same in both the main valley and the side valley
Has no effect on either the main valley or the side valley
2011.answer: Is greater in the main valley as compared to the side valley

2011.question: Match the geomorphic features in Group I with its corresponding details in Group II. Group I:P. Tombol Q. Bajada R. Erratic S. Rejuvenated valley Group II: 1. Lowering of sea level 2. Sand ridge connecting islands 3. Coalescence of alluvial fans 4. Rock fragment carried by glacier

2012.question: Match the landforms in Group-I with the causative processes in Group-II. Group-I: Yardang, Drumlin, Doline, Chenier. Group-II: Aeolian, Coastal, Dissolution, Glacial.
Which one of the following drainage patterns is typical of a doubly plunging antiformal terrain?
Which one of the following features is NOT associated with an oceanic subduction?

2013.question: Which one of the following is a glacio-fluvial deposit?

2014.question: In what type of country rock do sink-holes develop?

Match the landforms in Group-I with the causative processes in Group-II. Group-I: Strath, Drumlins, Cirque, Point bar.Group-II: Glacial deposition, Glacial erosion, Fluvial deposition, Fluvial erosion.

2015.question: Size of a kettle lake depends upon:
options: Size of the sediment carried by the glacier
Height of the valley through which the glacier moves
Size of the buried ice block within moraines
2015.answer: Size of the buried ice block within moraines

2015.question: Drainage density of a basin is defined as:
options: Sum of the number of streams of all orders divided by the area of the basin
Total length of streams of all orders divided by the area of the basin
Total number of the highest order streams divided by the total number of the next lower order streams
Length of the largest stream divided by the area of the basin
2015.answer: Total length of streams of all orders divided by the area of the basin

2016.question: The correct order of increasing stability of minerals during chemical weathering is:
The number of 4th order stream(s) present in the drainage network shown below, as per hierarchical classification, is:
Which among the following statements related to headward erosion by a river is/are correct? (Multiple Select Question)
options: Length of the main channel increases
answer: Length of the main channel increases

2017.question: Choose the landform(s) resulting from glacial erosion. (Multiple Select Question)

A drainage basin of fourth order covers an area of 40 sq. km. Within the basin, total length of 1st order drainage is 12.5 km, 2nd order drainage is 8.8 km, 3rd order drainage is 4.7 km and 4th order drainage is 4.0 km. The drainage density of the basin is ______ km⁻¹ (give answer in two decimal places).

2018.question: Match the processes in Group I (P. Dissolution, Q. Abrasion, R. Deposition, S. Onion skin weathering) with corresponding geomorphic features in Group II (1. Mushroom rocks, 2. Exfoliation domes, 3. Sinkholes, 4. Moraines).

2019.question: Which of the following is associated with a divergent plate boundary?
Match the geomorphic features in Group I (P. Eskers, Q. Natural levee, R. Chenier ridge, S. Plug dome) with corresponding environments in Group II (1. Beach, 2. Volcanic, 3. Glacial, 4. Fluvial).
Which of the following geomorphic features indicate(s) the presence of a fault? (Multiple Select Question)

2020.question: A trench is found at a:
Atoll is a geomorphic feature formed by:
Match the landform in Group I with the corresponding geological process in Group II. Group I P. Cinder Cone Q. Ox-bow lake R. Draas S. Drumlin Group II 1. Eolian 2. Glacial 3. Volcanic 4. Fluvial
Which of the following is/are correctly matched? (Multiple Select Question)
options: Dendritic drainage pattern - uniform substrate and gentle slope
Trellis drainage pattern - parallel valleys and ridges
Radial drainage pattern - uniform flat topography
Rectangular drainage pattern - joints and faults
answer: Dendritic drainage pattern - uniform substrate and gentle slope
Trellis drainage pattern - parallel valleys and ridges
Rectangular drainage pattern - joints and faults
